intro: Strophocaulon invisum, commonly known as the invisible strophocaulon, is a rare and elusive plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers that are often difficult to spot, hence its common name. The plant has a compact growth form with succulent leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its reproductive structures are adapted for pollination by specific insects that are also uncommon in its habitat. Due to its rarity and unique adaptations, Strophocaulon invisum is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
